sections.title: Experience — Rutgers Research Assistant
chunks: Built Python analysis pipeline for rodent auditory decision-making behavioral data; implemented drift diffusion modeling (DDM), statistical inference, and pose-tracking with angle analysis.

Built pipeline for neural recordings from electrode implants in auditory and parietal cortices; mapped electrode configuration/data to binary, spike sorting into units, developed decoders using SVM and pattern matching to predict behavior from neural activity; ran statistical analyses and linear regression.
Created schematics/visuals in Adobe Illustrator and Python; contributed to papers, posters, presentations; wrote papers and fellowship applications.

sections.title: Experience — Georgia Tech Research Institute
chunks: Performed qualitative content analysis (QCA) and frequency analyses on books, historic interview transcripts, and papers on cultural trauma/history and ontological security in Russia/Ukraine and group interactions in extremist groups.
Mined online data from Russian press releases/websites; assisted ML protocol in Python; visualized data using Adobe CC.

sections.title: Projects
chunks: Portfolio Optimization Dashboard (Dec 2025): Streamlit dashboard for optimizing portfolios with ML models (XGBoost, Random Forest, PCA, CatBoost) and user-set parameters; one result reported outperformance vs SPY by 4.17% in Sept 2025 (per resume).

Dose–Response Curve Dashboard (Dec 2025): Streamlit tool to simulate dose-response curves with 2/4/5PL and linear models; supports saving curves and suggesting dilution schemes based on error and linear regions.
CODA (Hack GT 9, Oct 2022): 2nd place overall; interactive rhythm game to help learn ASL using computer vision to track hand movements; built with Python, Figma, Unity.

Alzheimer’s Assessment (May 2023): CNN to assess Alzheimer’s severity from CT scans; preprocessing included oversampling, cropping, PCA; tried ResNet, AlexNet, PCANet; visualized performance and illustrated architectures with LaTeX.
